--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Derek James <blue5432@y...> wrote:
> Hey Roger,
> 
> --- Roger Smith <rog_21@y...> wrote:
> > Hi everyone,
> > Well we are set to go on our repository space at
> > ibiblio.
> > Our web address is: 
> > 
> > http://www.ibiblio.org/neat
> 
> Great!  Thanks for setting this up.
> 
> > Now we have to figure out what/how we want to break
> > up
> > the site and how to save our documentation?
> 
> As a starter suggestion, I'd suggest creating
> directories for each implementation of NEAT, based on
> the language/platform its written in, with an
> accompanying directory for documentation for each, and
> a directory for examples/benchmarks for each
> implementation.  It would also be nice to have a
> top-level directory with documentation related to NEAT
> (research papers, etc.) and perhaps a doc with an
> overview of each implementation (i.e., an elaboration
> of the section of Ken's NEAT User's page that talks
> about deciding which implementation to use.
> 
> Anybody else have ideas about how best to organize the
> NEAT repository?
> 

Are we making this a NEAT repository or a general neuroevolution
repository?  I had thought it was mostly going to be 
for keeping around benchmarks and experiments people can
easily take off the shelf and try out with any method.  

I think having sections for NEAT will be nice, but I already have NEAT
software organized and available from my website and our NN-group
website here at UT Austin.  So I think making a more general
repository would really add extra value for the outside community.  

ken
